sentence.text: PHARC (polyneuropathy, hearing loss, ataxia, retinitis pigmentosa, and cataracts) is a recently described autosomal-recessive neurodegenerative disease caused by mutations in the α-β-hydrolase domain-containing 12 gene (acylglycerol catabolic process).

The possible involvement of haploinsufficiency for DNA strand elongation involved in mitotic DNA replication, a DNA replication complex protein, in the short stature of the patient and her mother requires further studies.

entity.text: DNA strand elongation involved in mitotic DNA replication
